headline: Verizon Consumer Chief Exit Tests Schulman Turnaround And Frontier Integration
summary: Verizon Communications (NYSE:VZ) said its consumer division chief, Sowmyanarayan Sampath, is stepping down. The change comes as new CEO Dan Schulman pushes a broad transformation that includes integrating the Frontier Communications acquisition. Management is also focused on cost efficiency measures, workforce reductions, and a large share buyback program. For investors watching Verizon Communications at a share price of $47.01, this leadership change lands during a period of significant...

headline: How Verizon job cuts impact its 6% dividend yield
summary: Verizon cut 13,000 positions in Q4 of 2025, according to a CNBC report. While initial reports suggested job cuts could reach 15,000, CEO Dan Schulman made clear this is just the beginning of a multi-year efficiency drive. headline: Verizon’s Consumer Unit CEO Sowmyanarayan Sampath to Step Down
summary: Verizon’s  head of its consumer division,  Sowmyanarayan Sampath,  is stepping down, marking the latest shake-up as the company executes a strategic turnaround.  Sampath will stay in his role of chief executive of Verizon Consumer Group until the end of the first quarter before departing, the telecom company said Thursday.  The departure comes as Verizon undergoes big changes under its new chief executive,  Dan Schulman.

The departure comes as Verizon undergoes big changes under its new chief executive,  Dan Schulman.

headline: Verizon’s Sampath Leaves as Leadership Shakeup Continues
summary: Verizon Communications said Sowmyanarayan Sampath, CEO of  Verizon’s  consumer division, is stepping down, marking another major leadership change at the U.S. telecom company.  Sampath will stay with Verizon through the end of the first quarter, according to an email to Verizon employees viewed by Barron’s titled “Executive Leadership Transition.”  Alfonso Villanueva, who is currently the chief transformation officer, will serve as interim CEO of Verizon Consumer Group.

raw.headline: Verizon’s Sampath Leaves as Leadership Shakeup Continues
raw.summary: Verizon Communications said Sowmyanarayan Sampath, CEO of  Verizon’s  consumer division, is stepping down, marking another major leadership change at the U.S. telecom company.  Sampath will stay with Verizon through the end of the first quarter, according to an email to Verizon employees viewed by Barron’s titled “Executive Leadership Transition.”  Alfonso Villanueva, who is currently the chief transformation officer, will serve as interim CEO of Verizon Consumer Group.

headline: Starlink fuels SpaceX growth with potential phone, more internet services
summary: With a SpaceX IPO expected this year, the company has plans for its revenue-generating Starlink business that could expand its reach into new markets, including a Starlink phone, direct-to-device internet and a space-tracking service, sources familiar with the matter said.  The star of Elon Musk's empire, SpaceX is ​quickly expanding on the momentum with its speedy satellite production line with Starlink and its reusable rockets.  The plans include making a mobile device connected to its Starlink satellite internet constellation that could rival smartphones, according to three people familiar with the plans.

The plans include making a mobile device connected to its Starlink satellite internet constellation that could rival smartphones, according to three people familiar with the plans.

headline: Verizon Lawsuit Puts T-Mobile Advertising Claims And Valuation In Focus
summary: Verizon has filed a false advertising lawsuit against T-Mobile US, alleging exaggerated consumer savings claims in recent marketing. The lawsuit seeks damages and a court order to stop the challenged ads. The case centers on how T-Mobile, NasdaqGS:TMUS, compares its pricing to Verizon for wireless customers. T-Mobile US is a major US wireless carrier focused on mobile connectivity and related services, competing directly with Verizon and AT&T for subscriber growth and customer loyalty. The...

headline: Is Verizon (VZ) Pricing Reflect Future Cash Flow Strength After Recent Share Price Surge
summary: If you are wondering whether Verizon Communications is attractively priced or already fully valued, you are not alone. This article will focus on what the current share price might mean for long term investors. Verizon's share price sits at US$47.01, with returns of 19.3% over the last 7 days, 16.9% over the last 30 days, 16.0% year to date, 25.2% over 1 year, 42.2% over 3 years and 16.2% over 5 years. This raises questions about how much of its potential is already reflected in the...
